## Overview

This file contains specific passages extracted from source documents that will be cited in the final deliverables. Citations are organized by document/topic/question to match the structure of your drafts.

**Why extract citations:**
- Reduces token usage during drafting (don't need to re-read full source documents)
- Increases transparency (specific passages ready to cite)
- Improves accuracy (grounded in exact source text)
- Enables reuse across multiple documents in the project

## Usage Instructions

**During draft outline creation:**
1. Reference this file to copy relevant excerpts into draft document sections
2. Use the format: `**Key Citation** (from citations.md > [Section] > [Subtopic]):`
3. Include full citation excerpts inline in the outline (detailed outline format)

**During prose writing:**
1. Transform citations into conversational prose (don't just paste quotes)
2. Use inline HTML comments to track sources: `<!-- Source: path/to/source.md -->`
3. Refer back to this file if you need additional context or supporting quotes

**Updating citations:**
- If new sources are added to the project, extract and add citations here
- Mark sections with ⚠️ if additional research is needed
- Update the Coverage Assessment section as you gather more sources
